page.title: 10THE INN AT PORCHFIELD
page.content: The Sportsman's Rest is a public house and situated in the middle of Porchfield.It was first built of Island stone in 1598 as a hunting lodge and became a pub in 1870.The present landlord,Mel Clarke,is the seventeenth since that date and there have been many changes in the bars too.The most popular pub sport at present is pool.There are 5 players in the team and they play in the Cowes and district Pool League.Darts is not as popular as it was and the pub no longer has a darts team.The Juke box is very popular and always has the top forty records on it.The Porchfield cricket team uses the pub after it's matches which are played a short distance away.In September the locals challenge the Cricket Team to a fun match which is enjoyed by all.
